title: Drawing, "Putti in Four Octagons and Two Circles", 1810–1820
medium: pen and brown ink, brush with brown wash over black chalk with traces of graphite on laid paper
markings: Watermark: Escutcheon with a blacksmith's workshop, above, a crown.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Horizontal rectangle. Upper row: octagons showing first putto with bow and quiver at back; second putto running with wreath; third putto dancing with bowl and pitcher; fourth putto running and carrying dish.  Bottom row: circles. At left, male putto with spear and dog. At right, putto walking and carrying quiver upon left shoulder. All representations include landscapes.
